column3: Fraction of Time Steps with Sea Ice
column5: Fraction of time steps of the averaging period during which sea ice is present (siconc >0 ) in a grid cell
column9: area: mean where sea time: mean

column5: Total volume of sea ice divided by grid-cell area (this used to be called ice thickness in CMIP5)
column9: area: mean where sea time: mean

column5: Report temperature at interface, NOT temperature within lowermost model layer
column9: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)

column5: Mean height of sea-ice surface (=snow-ice interface when snow covered) above sea level
column9: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)

column3: Snow Heat Content per Unit Area
column5: Heat-content of all snow in grid cell divided by total grid-cell area. Snow-water equivalent at 0 Celsius is assumed to have a heat content of 0 J.  Does not include heat content of sea ice.
column9: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)

column5: Total flux of fresh water from sea-ice surface into underlying ocean. This combines both surface melt water that drains directly into the ocean and the drainage of surface melt pond. By definition, this flux is always positive.
column9: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)

column3: Sea-Ice Area Percentage Tendency Due to Thermodynamics
column5: Total change in sea-ice area fraction through thermodynamic processes
column9: area: mean where sea time: mean

column3: Sea-Ice Area Percentage Tendency Due to Dynamics
column5: Total change in sea-ice area fraction through dynamics-related processes (advection, divergence...)
column9: area: mean where sea time: mean

column5: Total change in sea-ice mass from thermodynamic processes divided by grid-cell area
column9: area: mean where sea time: mean

column5: Total change in sea-ice mass through dynamics-related processes (advection,...) divided by grid-cell area
column9: area: mean where sea time: mean

column5: The rate of change of sea ice mass through lateral melting divided by grid-cell area (report 0 if not explicitly calculated thermodynamically)
column9: area: mean where sea time: mean

column3: Snow Mass Rate of Change Through Evaporation or Sublimation
column5: the rate of change of snow mass through sublimation and evaporation divided by sea-ice area
column9: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)

column3: Snow Mass Rate of Change Through Advection by Sea-Ice Dynamics
column5: The rate of change of snow mass through advection with sea ice divided by sea-ice area
column9: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)

column3: Snow Mass Rate of Change Through Snow-to-Ice Conversion
column5: the rate of change of snow mass due to transformation of snow to sea ice divided by sea-ice area
column9: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)

column3: Snow Mass Rate of Change Through Wind Drift of Snow
column5: the rate of change of snow mass through wind drift of snow (from sea-ice into the sea) divided by sea-ice area
column9: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)

column3: Downwelling Shortwave Flux Under Sea Ice
column5: The downwelling shortwave flux underneath sea ice (always positive)
column9: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)

column3: Net Upward Sensible Heat Flux Under Sea Ice
column5: the net sensible heat flux under sea ice from the ocean
column9: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)

column3: Net Conductive Heat Flux in Ice at the Surface
column5: the net heat conduction flux at the ice surface
column9: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)

column3: Net Conductive Heat Fluxes in Ice at the Bottom
column5: the net heat conduction flux at the ice base
column9: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)

column3: Downward Sea Ice Basal Salt Flux
column5: This field is physical, and it arises since sea ice has a nonzero salt content, so it exchanges salt with the liquid ocean upon melting and freezing.
column9: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)

column5: Total flux of fresh water from water into sea ice divided by grid-cell area; This flux is negative during ice growth (liquid water mass decreases, hence upward flux of freshwater), positive during ice melt (liquid water mass increases, hence downward flux of freshwater)
column9: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)

column5: Speed of ice (i.e. mean absolute velocity) to account for back-and-forth movement of the ice
column9: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)

column3: X-Component of Ocean Stress on Sea Ice
column5: X-component of ocean stress on sea ice
column9: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)

column3: Y-Component of Ocean Stress on Sea Ice
column5: Y-component of ocean stress on sea ice
column9: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)

column3: Maximum Shear of Sea-Ice Velocity Field
column5: Maximum shear of sea-ice velocity field (second shear strain invariant)
column9: area: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc) time: point
column23: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field (single level) [XY-na] [amnsi-tpt]

column5: Total area of all Northern-Hemisphere grid cells that are covered by at least 15 % areal fraction of sea ice
column9: area: time: mean

column5: Total area of all Southern-Hemisphere grid cells that are covered by at least 15 % areal fraction of sea ice
column9: area: time: mean

column5: total volume of sea ice in the Northern hemisphere
column9: area: time: mean

column5: total volume of sea ice in the Southern hemisphere
column9: area: time: mean

column5: total area of sea ice in the Northern hemisphere
column9: area: time: mean

column5: total area of sea ice in the Southern hemisphere
column9: area: time: mean
